display_title.display_title:
Burkina Faso – Projet du
            Programme national de gestion des écosystèmes naturels
            (PRONAGEN) :  étude d’impact environnementale

Burkina Faso - Projet du Programme National

projn:
BF-Partnership For Natural Ecosystem
            Management Project -- P052400
subsc: Sub-national government administration,Other social services,Central government administration,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector
trustfund:
TF037303-BURKINA FASO - TRANSBORDER ARID LAND,TF036688-AFRICA - TRANSBORDER ARID LAND
            (MALI, BURKINA FASO),TF020517-GEF-PPG: TRANSBOUNDARY ARID
            RANGELAND AND BIODIVERSITY PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Natural Ecosystem
            Management Project aims at developing biodiversity
            protection in trans-border arid rangelands, through a
            national ecosystems management strategy in forestry, and
            wildlife conservation, including livestock, and range
            management. This environmental assessment examines potential
            negative impacts, within a participatory approach, and,
            reviews the country's legal, and regulatory framework,
            where the evolutionary nature of the decentralization
            policy, provided a formal framework for the project
            implementation. Although by and large, the project will have
            positive impacts on natural resources, and biodiversity
            conservation, adverse socioeconomic aspects may be
            potentially distressed in the medium term, discussed
            separately in the Social Assessment report. Despite the
            project's potential positive environmental impacts,
            mitigation measures are as follows. Hunters associations,
            and fishermen groups, through integrated participatory
            approaches, will survey activities, looking for possible
            substitution activities, such as appropriate eco-tourism
            practices, while groups whose livelihoods depend on forestry
            and livestock resources, as well as women's groups,
            will oversee management control plans. In partnership with
            agriculture departments, the program will ensure river
            basins' water quality in the control of irrigation
            practices, and natural water flows. Technical partnerships
            will ensure management plans to control soil degradation,
            and intensive agricultural activities. Public consultations
            will be decentralized, in an aim to ensure compliance at the
            local level, of both environmental, and human development aspects.
